content: Who was the first to sail around the world?

The first person to sail around the world was Ferdinand Magellan, a Portuguese explorer who undertook the journey between 1519 and 1522. However, it's worth noting that Magellan himself did not complete the entire circumnavigation; he died during the expedition in the Philippines. It was his crew, under the command of Juan Sebastián Elcano, who completed the voyage and returned to Spain. The expedition was sponsored by the Spanish Crown and was the first to accomplish a circumnavigation of the Earth.
